column4: Hey guys. I'm a complete newb when it comes to linux. I have ubuntu 6.06 desktop-amd62 installed (because I dont know linux at all). I noticed that there is a "add/remove software" (and also another one for more complex installations), which is great if what I'm looking for is in the list. However what I want to install is not on the list. I download the .tar file, and I then extract it, but I don't know what to do from there. Can any
Admin: yeah thats the one for the more complex installations, right?
I know how to open it, though, if thats what you're asking.
MythTV. I downloaded it (to desktop by default), and then I extracted it (the folder is on the desktop). And I don't know where to go from there.
all the contents of the tar file
the whole software

Hey guys I just installed MySQL-server and MySQL-client through Synaptic. It says everything has been installed. Now I'm wondering how to make sure it's been installed, and how to configure everything. Also, I'm wondering how to locate the client so I can start using it.
the client can be accessed by 'mysql' username is root, password is blank
I'm not sure exactly what you mean. I'm using desktop version...
open a terminal, you can use the baisc client from there
you might also want to check out phpmyadmin for a web interface
I open up the terminal server client but I'm still unsure of what you mean.... sorry, but I really don't know much of what I'm doing
just to be surew - you're trying to run mysql commands?
Well I'd like to first create users for the database. I'm not sure if that would fall under that category?
it would. Would you like a command line interface, or a web interface?

I wont be needing to run any commands from any other computer so I don't feel the need to install phpmyadmin. I just need to do a few things from this machine (the one mysql is installed on) so I think command line would be ok
okay then, first open a terminal (should be under the application menu)
yeah I have that open
type 'mysql -u root -p ""'
ok
ok thanks a lot. I "Terminal server client" open instead of "terminal". Thanks again!
tsc is for connecting to windows systems I think
yeah VNC and stuff
something like that
